title: Seyfert Mill
text:
Seyfert Mill is a historic <a href="grist%20mill">grist mill</a> located in <a href="Upper%20Tulpehocken%20Township%2C%20Berks%20County%2C%20Pennsylvania">Upper Tulpehocken Township</a>, <a href="Berks%20County%2C%20Pennsylvania">Berks County, Pennsylvania</a>. The combined mill and house building was built in 1840, and is a 2 1/2-story, with basement, banked stone building. It measures . Also on the property are the contributing millrace and pond. The mill ceased operation in about 1954.
It was listed on the <a href="National%20Register%20of%20Historic%20Places">National Register of Historic Places</a> in 1990.
